page.title: 06LANDSCAPE
page.content: Dominating the area from every viewpoint is the estuary of the River Eden, at its widest 1\km but nipped in the middle by the low Cable Shore. At low tide great expanses of mud deposited by the river are visible. South of the estuary the land gently rises to a height of about 60m above sea level. The gentle slope is broken by a steep slope, a cliff line, where the land climbs abruptly by about 15m. North of the River Eden a steep river cliff about 20m high gives way to an undulating plateau between 20-25m high which stretches to the valley of the Moonzie Burn.
